metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14156 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The atyfb_ioctl function in drivers/video/fbdev/aty/atyfb_base.c in the Linux kernel through 4.12.10 does not initialize a certain data structure, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory by reading locations associated with padding bytes. It was discovered that the ATI Radeon framebuffer driver in the Linux kernel did not properly initialize a data structure returned to user space. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-17-generic - 4.13.0-17.20
